clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Nano-crystalline Hydroxyapatite Silica Gel in Management of Periodontal Intrabony Defects
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Radiographic Evaluation of Nano-crystalline Hydroxyapatite Silica Gel in the Treatment of Human Periodontal Intrabony Defects: A Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A clinical and radiographic evaluation of Nano-crystalline hydroxyapatite silica gel in comparison with bone allograft and open flap debridement for management of periodontal intrabony defects.

detailed_description.textblock: Thirty patients suffering from advanced chronic periodontitis were included in this randomized controlled clinical trial. Each subject contributed matched two- or three-walled intrabony defects. Patients were equally randomly assigned into the experimental group; Nano-crystalline hydroxyapatite silica gel or the positive control group; bone allograft or negative control group;open flap debridement. Clinical and radiographic parameters were recorded at baseline and at 3 and 6 months postoperatively.

primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in clinical attachment level in mm in chronic periodontitis patients at 6 month

secondary_outcome.description: Estimation of pocket depth in mm in chronic periodontitis patients at baseline and 6 months
Estimation of bone fill defect area in mm square in chronic periodontitis patients at baseline and 6 month

arm_group.description: hydroxyapaptite bone graft with nano particle size in silica gel will be used to fill in the defect after opening a periodontal flap
commercially available demineralized freeze-dried bone allograft will be used to fill in the defect after opening a periodontal flap
an open periodontal flap without adding bone graft.

intervention.description: it is a type of synthetic bone graft.
it is a type of bone graft from human cadavers.
a periodontal surgical procedure for the purpose of debridement.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Severe chronic periodontitis patients.
- having at least one site with pocket depth ≥ 6 mm and clinical attachment level ≥ 5 mm, with radiographic evidence of bone loss as detected in periapical radiographs.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- Subjects had <22 permanent teeth
- Having any given systemic disease
- Taking any type of medication and/or antibiotic therapy during the 3 months before the study
- Received periodontal treatment within the past 12 months Current or former smokers
